name: Chicken Tortilla Soup in the Instant Pot®
author: Penny Momma
summary: Everyone asks for this recipe... It's easy to make and adapt to your own level of spiciness. Kids love it! And for the kids who don't, you can use some of the shredded chicken in a quick chicken quesadilla! Win-win! Optional toppings and mix-ins: avocado slices, shredded Mexican cheese, rice, sour cream, and chopped cilantro.
ingredients: 2 (10 ounce) cans diced tomatoes and green chiles (such as RO*TEL®)
1 pinch chili powder, or to taste
½ cup crushed tortilla chips, or to taste
directions: Combine chicken broth, diced tomatoes and chiles, chicken, black beans, enchilada sauce, corn, onion, garlic, cumin, salt, pepper, and chili powder in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®)
Select Poultry setting according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 15 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 10 minutes
Remove chicken and shred with two forks
Ladle into individual bowls to serve and top with crushed tortilla chips
